Posts.EditableText:
How much store, as a player, do you put in being able to see your previous commands?

Quest has an option to turn this off, and I really like how clean it keeps things, but I don't want to do so if players find having a record of past commands useful.
Posts.HTML:
How much store, as a player, do you put in being able to see your previous commands?

Quest has an option to turn this off, and I really like how clean it keeps things, but I don't want to do so if players find having a record of past commands useful.

Posts.EditableText: I use it to save typing; I can remember what did.
Posts.HTML: I use it to save typing; I can remember what did.

Posts.EditableText: What do you mean when you say you use it to save typing?
Posts.HTML: What do you mean when you say you use it to save typing?

Posts.EditableText: Wait, are we talking about different things? I mean you can scroll back though previous commands using the up arrow key.
Posts.HTML: Wait, are we talking about different things? I mean you can scroll back though previous commands using the up arrow key.

Posts.EditableText:
Oh, I see. Yes, different things.

I simply mean the option which allows the author to turn off the players' commands. So rather than the usual:

[quote:3kh5vuoe]You are in the kitchen. You can go north.
>n

You are in the living room. You can go east.
>e

You are...[/quote:3kh5vuoe]
It would look like:

[quote:3kh5vuoe]You are in the kitchen. You can go north.

You are in the living room. You can go east.

You are...[/quote:3kh5vuoe]
It just prevent the players' previous commands from showing on the screen.
Posts.HTML:
Oh, I see. Yes, different things.

You are in the kitchen. You can go north.
>n

You are in the living room. You can go east.
>e

You are...


It would look like:

You are in the living room. You can go east.

You are...


It just prevent the players' previous commands from showing on the screen.
